page.title: 01INTRODUCTION
page.content: The M2 motorway crosses the area. To NE of M2 it is mainly residential and to the SW it is mainly farmland.The main industrial estate lies along the river Medway - includes a factory where first flying boat was built. In NE of area there is an upland section once owned by the war department and used to build underground defences to prevent possible invasion by Napoleon.It was named Fort Pitt and became a military hospital from 1819 until 1918. Then sold to the local authority and became home of a girls' school which still flourishes. An art college now occupies site of original blockhouse and a college of further education has also been built within Fort Pitt area. Surroundings now used for recreation. Near is boy-hood home of Charles Dickens and oldest hospital in country -St. Bartholomews-once a Leper colony
